intro: Stellilabium andinum, commonly known as the Andean star-labium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
